alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 19 at 12:48AM PST until December 19 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON BELOW 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Freezing rain below 4500 feet. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze. * WHERE...Wallowa County. * WHEN...Until 1 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Very slippery sidewalks, roads and bridges are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Wallowa Valley will be the primary area for freezing rain. Temperatures are above freezing in the Imnaha Valley where freezing rain is not expected.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
